metadata.title: Free Virtual Data Science Conferences You Should Check Out in 2020 | by Alexandra Amidon | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: Free Virtual Data Science Conferences You Should Check Out in 2020
metadata.description: Due to the COVID19 pandemic, large gatherings like data science conferences are no longer prudent. Rather than canceling conferences altogether, many organizers have made them virtual—and some have…

all_paragraphs: Due to the COVID19 pandemic, large gatherings like data science conferences are no longer prudent. Rather than canceling conferences altogether, many organizers have made them virtual—and some have made their conference free! This is a great opportunity for those with preexisting travel or budget constraints (conferences can be expensive!). You can still enjoy many of the benefits of a data science conference from the comfort of your couch.

Data science conferences have much to offer: speakers with big ideas about the trajectory of the field, conference sessions that dive into cutting-edge topics, experts with applied experience in the field, networking, etc. Much of these benefits can still be realized at a virtual conference.
Before I share a list of conferences to check out, I’ll start with a brief summary of how the data science conference experience has changed.
Disclaimer — I am not affiliated with nor sponsored by any of the conferences listed in this article. All conferences listed were selected because they appeared interesting and useful to myself.
This list highlights conferences that are currently virtual. I may update this list in the future. The list sorted in order of date.

The Spark + AI Summit covers topics related to Apache Spark and AI, with different tracks for developers, data scientists, and executives who week to apply the best data tools and use AI to build innovative products. At the virtual conference, you will learn about:

The conference is virtual and open to everyone. Conference sessions are free, though half- and full-day training courses and certification courses come at a cost. The Summit offers over 200 sessions across 5 days.

“Data and AI need to be unified. But the best AI applications require massive amounts of constantly updated training data to build state-of-the-art models. Apache Spark™ is the only unified analytics engine that combines large-scale data processing with state-of-the-art machine learning and AI algorithms.”

Data & Analytics: Live is an end-to-end digital conference that replicates an in-person conference with keynote theatres, an interactive exhibition, virtual meet-the-speaker breakout sessions, and networking areas. The conference seeks to equip attendees with the best practices and insights needed to extract business value and actionable insights from data. The conference is targeted at both executives and tech-savy data practitioners. Sessions will be both live and on-demand.

Free passes are only available for Data/ Analytics Practitioners from all industries who do not offer as their core business any solutions, recruitment services, consultancy or offer any software/hardware solutions within the data community.

The Future of AI event showcases “the latest innovations, technologies and business models in AI” and brings together “the leading companies, startups, investors, developers and tech giants for a chance to explore, learn and network together.” The conference seeks to support the growth and business strategies of members and business and technology leaders by connecting them through networking opportunities and provide the latest content related to AI.
Participation in the conference is free, but space is limited.

AI4 is a three-day conference that focuses on the adoption and application of artificial intelligence and machine learning to the enterprise. The conference takes a “use-case oriented approach to content” and provides “a common framework for thinking about what AI means to each industry and deliver content that progresses understanding at any stage of an organization’s AI journey”. Both business leaders and data practitioners would find this conference valuable.
To attend for free, you must apply for a conference pass. Ai4 2020 is free to attend for qualifying applicants who are…

All content from NVIDIA’s GPU Technology Conference, which includes the latest breakthroughs in a wide range of topics such as AI, HPC, accelerated data science, healthcare, graphics, and more, is freely available on the GTC On Demand platform. NVIDIA is already planning the next GTC Digital event!

Sessions in this conference by DataRobot promises to teach attendees how AI is impacting organizations meaningfully and how to address critical issues to your organization. There are sessions with use cases from pioneers across various industries and with practical insights on how to be successful with AI. All recorded sessions are freely available.

MongoDB.live featured more than 100 educational talks and an exciting keynote session packed with announcements. Sessions are now available on-demand for free. This is a great source of content related to the MongoDB database software.

PyCon 2020 is “the largest annual gathering for the community using and developing the open-source Python programming language.” The sessions recorded from the conference cover a variety of python-related topics, such as language features, machine learning, and data engineering.
Date TBD — “More like it are coming”

O’Reilly has canceled all conferences in 2020; however, continues to host live, online events with interactive tutorials. In addition, the O’Reilly online learning platform contains a large amount of organized content (including recorded conference sessions from previous events) related to various topics in data science, data engineering, machine learning, programming, and visualization. The online learning platform is not free, but O’Reilly is currently offering a 10-day free trial.
Your home for data science. A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas and codes.
Data scientist working in the financial services industry
